name: Bouillabaisse with Rouille
description: Classic French seafood stew with a rich saffron broth, served with toasted bread and spicy rouille sauce.

Bouillabaisse: 1 cup each chopped onion and leek
Fresh herb sprigs: thyme, parsley, fennel fronds, basil
1 1/2 lbs mixed seafood: peeled shrimp, wild cod, halibut, sole, scrubbed mussels or clams
Rouille: 1 roasted and peeled red bell pepper

ingredients: 1 cup each chopped onion and leek
Fresh herb sprigs: thyme, parsley, fennel fronds, basil
1 1/2 lbs mixed seafood: peeled shrimp, wild cod, halibut, sole, scrubbed mussels or clams
1 roasted and peeled red bell pepper
instructions: Heat oil in tall pot over medium heat. Add onion and leek and cook gently until softened.

Stir in garlic and cook 1 minute, then add tomatoes, water, herbs, saffron, salt and fish bones (and shrimp shells). Bring to simmer, then reduce heat so broth bubbles slowly without boiling. Cook 30 minutes.
Strain broth into a large bowl and discard solids. Pour broth back in pot and bring to boil.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, 1-2 minutes. Add rest of fish and shellfish, cover and simmer until mussels or clams open.
Add salt and ground pepper if needed.
For the rouille: Puree the roasted red bell pepper, hot red chili pepper, lemon juice, cooked potato, and sea salt in a food processor until smooth.
Slowly add olive oil while processing to form a paste.
Serve bouillabaisse with toasted bread and rouille on the side.
